issue.title: Remove Python 2 support from Python rules

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the feature request:

With Python 2 having been deprecated 2+ years ago, I think it's time to drop support for it in the Python rules.

The *main* motivator here is to make re-implementing the rules in Starlark easier: there's a lot of tests and special code that just deals with Python 2: srcs_version compatibility checking, propagation of that, an aspect to identify mismatches, the python_version transition, etc. Re-implementing all that just doesn't make sense for a dead platform.

So, I'm filing this issue as a canonical tracking issue to figure out how to go about dropping this support in Bazel.

Analogous rules_python issue: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_python/issues/886

It's been decided that Python 2 support will be dropped as part of Bazel 7. This is also to simplify Starlarkifying the Python rules.

Flag flip tracking issue: #17293

Various refs:
 * https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/6444

issue.title: Flag --incompatible_python_disable_py2 will break Bazel toolchains in Bazel 7.0

repository.name: bazel-toolchains
repository.description: Repository that hosts Bazel toolchain configs for remote execution and related support tools.

issue.body:
Incompatible flag `--incompatible_python_disable_py2` will be enabled by default in the next major release (Bazel 7.0), thus breaking Bazel toolchains. Please migrate to fix this and unblock the flip of this flag.

The flag is documented here: [bazelbuild/bazel#17293](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/17293).

Please check the following CI builds for build and test results:

- [Ubuntu 16.04 OpenJDK 8](https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazelisk-plus-incompatible-flags/builds/1408#0185f0c4-659c-41a1-a4cd-9a17d57f5852)

Never heard of incompatible flags before? We have [documentation](https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/backward-compatibility.html) that explains everything.
If you have any questions, please file an issue in https://github.com/bazelbuild/continuous-integration.

issue.title: Remove Python 2 configuration and targets

repository.name: rules_foreign_cc
repository.description: Build rules for interfacing with "foreign" (non-Bazel) build systems (CMake, configure-make, GNU Make, boost, ninja, Meson)

issue.body:
Bazel is dropping support for Python 2

Also raises the minimum Bazel version in the examples to 5.0, as 4.0 has built-in dependencies on Python 2.

Fixes https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_foreign_cc/issues/1005

Work towards https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/17293

body:
Thanks. Copying the list so I can edit it myself.

* [x]  **Bazel toolchains:** [Flag --incompatible_python_disable_py2 will break Bazel toolchains in Bazel 7.0bazel-toolchains#995](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-toolchains/issues/995)
  * Sent https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-toolchains/pull/996
* [x]  **rules_foreign_cc:** [Flag --incompatible_python_disable_py2 will break rules_foreign_cc in Bazel 7.0rules_foreign_cc#1005](https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_foreign_cc/issues/1005)
  * Sent https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_foreign_cc/pull/1006
* [x]  **rules_jvm_external:** [Flag --incompatible_python_disable_py2 will break rules_jvm_external in Bazel 7.0rules_jvm_external#846](https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_jvm_external/issues/846)
  * Sent https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_jvm_external/pull/847
* [x]  **rules_nodejs:** [Flag --incompatible_python_disable_py2 will break rules_nodejs in Bazel 7.0rules_nodejs#3619](https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/3619)
  * Sent https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/pull/3620

Hi @keertk 

Can you trigger another incompatible build? I'm about ready to flip this flag, but would like another run to double check things.

So looks like rules_nodejs is still failing:
https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazelisk-plus-incompatible-flags/builds/1415#01860f63-baf7-4523-a762-c201d59cb82b
https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazelisk-plus-incompatible-flags/builds/1415#01860f63-bafa-4e7a-ae47-540d7218134d
https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazelisk-plus-incompatible-flags/builds/1415#01860f63-bb0b-4196-95dc-73a715caf534
https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazelisk-plus-incompatible-flags/builds/1415#01860f63-bb0d-41de-82b7-cbb14c1991d9

Everything else looks good!

Thanks.

From what I can tell, the version of nodejs the pipeline used doesn't contain my fix. The pipeline used e5c7a3d0013d257fec4db5c3a01a2050a9a7c6d1. I have no idea why? I can see my fix merged into nodejs's stable branch. I don't see where the pipeline gets the commit to check out from, though. The nodejs commit with my fix is 4b8bcf2f7c07d2f44a2fa7c6ce1f7431d277f7ed

Any ideas? Is this the fault of the incompatible-flags pipeline (does it need to be started anew?), or some fault in nodejs's configuration that incompatible-flags pipeline reads? (I can't find any indication in their .bazelci config that would indicate such).
@rickeylev checking and will keep you posted!

I was digging around trying to find anything. I found this another invocation:

```
BUILDKITE_COMMAND="curl -sS https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bazelbuild/continuous-integration/master/buildkite/bazelci.py?1675462537 -o bazelci.py
python3.6 bazelci.py runner --task=ubuntu1804 --http_config=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/stable/.bazelci/presubmit.yml --git_repository=https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs.git --git_commit=e5c7a3d0013d257fec4db5c3a01a2050a9a7c6d1 --use_but"
```

from https://buildkite.com/bazel/bazelisk-plus-incompatible-flags/builds/1419#0186195a-0aa4-4b42-ba61-9a8334058e66

Note the --git_commit is using the commit that is too old. I can't find where that is set, though. There must be something that sets that variable, though.
I found a bit of code in bazelci.py that seems to indicate that it will use the last green commit of a project. rules_nodejs says its red right now so....maybe that's it.

Except for the rules_nodejs issue, this flag is ready to flip. (As far as I know, of course)

After talking with Yun, I'm going to submit the flag flip now. It _technically_ will show as breaking rules_nodejs, but rules_nodejs is, due to pre-existing failures, stuck at an older commit that doesn't have the necessary fix (the fix is using rules_pkg version 0.3.0+).
